Event.name: Sending
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Sender</fen> plans the <fen>Path</fen> (along with <fen>Source</fen> and <fen>Goal</fen>) of a <fen>Theme</fen> and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this <fen>Path</fen> under the power of some entity other than the <fen>Sender</fen>. This frame also has a <fen>Recipient</fen> distinct from the <fen>Goal</fen>, as both can be present: <ex>I <t>sent</t> the manuscript <fex name="Goal">to England</fex> <fex name="Recipient">to Bill</fex>.</ex> <ex>I <t>forwarded</t> the grain <fex name="Recipient">to a dealer</fex> <fex name="Goal">in Frankfurt</fex>.</ex>
This frame contains verbs that participate in the ditransitive construction, with a recipient as the direct object, as in the following: <ex>I <t>sent</t> <fex name="Recipient">Bill</fex> the manuscript.</ex> Certain Verbs in this Frame focus on the initial sending act, while others do not. For example, <ment>I sent it rapidly</ment> can either mean the act of sending was initiated quickly or that it moved quickly. However, the in following sentence: <ment>I exported/dispatched it rapidly</ment>, meaning that the act was begun quickly, both types of verbs are included.</def-root>

Arg.name: Sender
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the person who initiates the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> and, unlike Carrying, does not accompany it.</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>Path along which movement occurs. I shipped the books <fex name="Path">along Interstate 65</fex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root>The end of the path and intended goal of the sending. I <t>sent</t> the logs <fex name="Goal">to the shed</fex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root>The beginning of the path, similar to source except that it serves to define the path. I sent wood <fex name="Source">from Illinois</fex> <fex name="Goal">to California</fex>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>The objects being sent. I mailed <fex name="Theme">the books</fex> <fex name="Goal">to Alaska</fex>. Note that <fen>Theme</fen> may be multiply instantiated. They <t>mailed</t><fex name="Theme">a questionnaire</fex> <fex name="Theme">with a return envelope</fex>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Transport_means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The mode of sending employed. I <t>shipped</t> <fex name="Theme">the crops</fex> <fex name="Transport_means">by bigrig </fex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the <fen>Sender</fen> or <fen>Theme</fen> <ex>He <t>faxed</t> his order <fex name="dep">while brushing his teeth</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Distance
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is any expression characterizing the extent of motion of the Theme. Pat <t>threw</t> the Javelin <fex name="Distance">50 meters</fex>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Recipient
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the recipient of the sent <fen>Theme</fen>. <fex name="Sender">Tess</fex> <t>mailed</t> <fex name="Theme">a letter</fex> <fex name="Recipient"> to Abby</fex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> of the sending. <ex>Rachel <t>sent</t> the letter to her mother <fex name="Purpose">to let her know about the marriage</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> for the sending. <ex>Letters are generally <t>forwarded</t> for several months <fex name="exp">because people are lazy about telling people their new location</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>When the sending takes place <ex>I <t>sent</t> the letter to you <fex name="Time">last week</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cotheme
Arg.definition: <def-root>An additional theme sent along with the main <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Container
Arg.definition: <def-root>A container in which the <fen>Theme</fen> is sent. <ex>Please send in the request <fex name="Cont">in a self-addressed stamped envelope</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A spatial setting encomnpassing the Source location, where the Sending event takes place.
<ex>Barney <t>posted</t> the letter on Monday <fex name="Place">in Athens</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: send.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. cause to go or be taken or delivered to a particular destination.

lexUnit.name: mail.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. send (a letter or parcel) by post.

lexUnit.name: ship.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to be transported (esp. on a ship).

lexUnit.name: post.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. chiefly Brit. send via the postal system.

lexUnit.name: export.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: send (goods or services) to another country for sale.

lexUnit.name: route.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: v.1.routeing or routing with obj. and adverbial of direction send or direct along a specified course.

lexUnit.name: dispatch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: send off promptly to a destination or for a purpose.

lexUnit.name: shipment [items].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a consignment of goods shipped.

lexUnit.name: shipment [act].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of shipping goods.

lexUnit.name: express.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: send in the post with a short delivery time

lexUnit.name: barge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: send via a vessell that travels through the water

lexUnit.name: wire.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: send by telegram or electronically

lexUnit.name: refer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pass a matter to a higher body for a decision.
